question: Why Barium in a suitable form is administered to patients before an X-ray examination of the stomach?
option1: barium allows X-rays to pass through the stomach on account of its transparency to X-rays
option2: barium compound, like magnesium sulphate helps in cleaning the stomach before X-ray examination
option3: barium is a good absorber of X-rays and this helps the stomach to appear clearly in contrast with the other regions in the picture
option4: barium salts are white in colour and this helps the stomach to appear clearly in contrast with other regions in the picture
answer: barium is a good absorber of X-rays and this helps the stomach to appear clearly in contrast with the other regions in the picture
explanation: Barium is given in adequate amount to patients before X-ray examination. The gut (gastrointestinal tract) does not show up very well on ordinary X-ray pictures. However, if you drink a white liquid that contains a chemical called barium sulphate, the outline of the upper parts of the gut (oesophagus, stomach and small intestines) shows up clearly on X-ray pictures. This is because X-rays do not pass through barium.
